definition: to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
building/shop/term for certain service establishments/embassy or consulate/schoolroom (old)/CL:家[jia1]

sentences.english: The Chinese Embassy has already sent a working group to visit them.
sentences.chinese: 中国驻日使领馆已经派工作组探望了有关渔民。

sentences.english: Check with the U.S. embassy in your country to see whether other documentation is necessary.
sentences.chinese: 请向驻贵国的美国使领馆询问是否需要其他材料。

sentences.english: National flags flew at half-mast in public places, at Chinese embassies and at consulates.
sentences.chinese: 全国和驻外使领馆下半旗志哀。

sentences.english: And also the supervisor, of course, at the post would do that.
sentences.chinese: 当然，使领馆的上级官员也会这样做。

sentences.english: Its main responsibility is to provide services for the Foreign Ministry and the Chinese diplomatic and consular missions overseas.
sentences.chinese: 主要担负部机关及驻外使领馆服务工作任务。

sentences.english: Our FCS China office supports these trade and tourism missions.
sentences.chinese: 美国驻华使领馆商务处为这些访团提供支持。

sentences.english: The wait is 30 days or less at fully 90 percent of U.S. embassies and consulates.
sentences.chinese: 等候时间低于30天的使领馆至少占90%。

definition: consulate general/same as 總領事館|总领事馆[zong3 ling3 shi4 guan3]
Ministry of Foreign Affairs/foreign office/Dept. of State
